articles.description: According to a doctor at the University of Pennsylvania, the toes typically are painful to the touch.
articles.content:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. -- A coronavirus (COVID-19) symptom in children and young adults first reported in Europe is now reportedly being spotted in pediatrician offices across the U.S.
Medical professionals have dubbed the symptom COVID toes," based on a discol… [+1017 chars]

articles.title: Dermatologist: ‘COVID toes’ a potential symptom of the new coronavirus - WSFA
articles.description: A dermatologist is looking at a link between an inflammatory reaction of the toes and COVID-19.
articles.content:
EVANSTON, Ill. (Gray News) - A dermatologist is looking at a link between an inflammatory reaction of the toes and COVID-19.
Paller is calling for more testing on the condition so doctors can learn more about the link between the potential symptom and COVID-… [+548 chars]

articles.author: Rachel Paula Abrahamson
articles.title: Fauci says tooth fairy can't get coronavirus - TODAY
articles.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci assured a 7-year-old girl named Ava that the Tooth Fairy can't catch the coronavirus.
articles.content:
The Tooth Fairy has some wiggle room when it comes to social distancing, according to COVID-19 expert Dr. Anthony Fauci.
Fauci shared the fact while chatting with a 7-year-old girl named Ava on Will Smiths new Snapchat series Will From Home.
